title: The Map That Named America
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Map That Named America.

hook.text: America was named after the wrong person. A German mapmaker made a mistake that stuck forever.

buildup.text: In 1507, Martin WaldseemÃ¼ller drew a world map labeling the New World 'America' after Amerigo Vespucci.

discovery.text: Vespucci was an Italian explorer who realized South America was a separate continent, not part of Asia.

twist.text: Columbus reached the Americas first but never realized it was a new continent. Vespucci got the credit.

climax.text: WaldseemÃ¼ller later regretted the name and removed it from later maps. But 1,000 copies had already spread.

punchline.text: A printing error named two continents.

quiz.question: Who is the Americas named after?
